comment: Class is easy, but I wish there was more enthusiasm to make the class more interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took her 4 week summer physics class and it was a breeze. It is 1 hw assignment each week about 15 questions(extra 20% points each question if completed 24 hours before its due, BEST EXTRA CREDIT) and 1 exam each week + final exam (lowest hw and exam grade is dropped). Great video lectures. Take her if you can made a super hard class very easy!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Love her. So much extra credit

You're graded just on 10 worksheets, you'll NEED the lab manual as it tells you how to complete them. She writes & explains the required equations on the board & will take any questions as long as it's not deliberately giving you the answer. She had rules like no drinking or texting which seemed unnecessary but it's a very doable lab class.

My semester was tough, but Professor Kaplan made Physics 1 manageable. She's a great lecturer, very kind, and truly cares. Breakout sessions are optional and give bonus points on the final—unlike other professors who require them. I wouldn't have passed without her. I'd recommend Professor Kaplan to anyone taking Physics 1.
Clear expectations, soft-spoken, and very intelligent. She knows what to do and how to do it. Just show up and if you're confused she will help you. Just don't be afraid to talk to her!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Kaplan was by far one of my favorite science professors. She never hesitated to stop lectures to answer questions students had as well as being very upfront with what will be on tests. She is really not trying to trick you with questions and really wants you to do well!

Professor Kaplan made this class very enjoyable. She is very knowledgeable in physics and the math behind the material. She offers a ton of extra credit, and grades the exams very fast. This course should be an easy A, due to the material not being challenging and also due to her going out of her way to help us with bonus opportunities.

one the best professors I have ever taken. she really cares and wants everyone to succeed. she will walk you through every problem with plenty of detail. would suggest to ANYONE if they want to pass physics.

Professor Kaplan was great, my only complaint is she is not the best teacher. However, because class was not mandatory I just learned on my own and her exams are so easy that it makes up for it. Extra credit is given if you go to the break-out sessions.

Took PHYS 1111 during the summer, & was honestly easy. She provides extra credit opportunities (attending break out sessions & bonus questions on the exams). She allowed 1 sided page of cheat sheet for each exam. Her exams were VERY similar to the in-class worksheets & break-out session worksheets. I attended her office hrs once & was very helpful.

I LOVE HER! I have always struggled with math and was really worried that taking a physics class in the summer was not a good idea. Tests are very easy and is pulled from the breakout sessions, PPTS, and the worksheets she gives in class. I would totally take her again!!

SHE IS AMAZING FOR LAB! There are only 10 labs and she explains everything we need to do for each lab before we begin and will help you throughout too! She drops the lowest lab grade and is a super easy grader! I would take her over anyone!!

TAKE HER FOR PHYSICS PLEASE!! She is so caring and so sweet and truly wants everyone to succeed. I had never taken Physics before and Professor Kaplan made it so easy for everyone. The tests are straight from the lectures, breakout sessions, and homeworks and she drops the lowest one. I love her and wish I could take her for all physics courses!

Awesome professor for physics!!! I highly reccomend her!! Offers a lot of extra credit which will help with your grade. Questions on the tests are literally from the lectures and breakout session problem sets. She wants her students to pass the class and is willing to help you for any concern.

She is so great!!! There are four tests and a final. On each test she would put bonus that tremendously helped my grade. Her practice problems in the PowerPoints are the test!! I went to office hours and she was so helpful. Love her !!!

I took Dr. Kaplan for lecture and lab and she's the easiest professor I've had. So much extra credit its almost ridiculous. Just pay attention in lecture and you should get everything down pretty easily. Tests were all multiple choice, usually about half conceptual half math. Just study the slides and breakout session problems and you'll be good

Had Dr. Kaplan for Phys 1 lecture & lab. She's a kind physics professor who is very smart, understanding, and always willing to help and answer any question you may have. The class itself is not very difficult, just study lecture notes and her examples.
Dr.Kaplan is a very kind and caring instructor. One lab is dropped out of all of them. Attendance is required. She will answer any and every question you have.

Lab means you just follow the lab manual, she helps you with filling out the lab work by giving you formulas for it. Always seems confused in lab though, and can't explain what you're supposed to be doing. Either you figure it out, or she goes in circles explaining without explaining. Do the work, get any easy A/B on the lab work.

Terrible explainer. Class is pure lecture. Always seems unsure of what she's saying, ends every sentence with "okay?" as if asking us to consent to the laws of physics. No practice problem sheets, no study guides or test review. HW has little relation to class. Passive aggressive if you're confused, says "Are you just going to copy my work?".

you HAVE to get the Lab manual from the bookstore ($25), it's all from that, you do the lab on your own but she will come answer questions if you have something. 
She won't really lecture but writes the formulas you'll use and all the labs are very easy

She's really great. She wants feedback to improve the class and will listens to input. she mostly solves the problems with you on the PowerPoint and doesn't slow down unless you ask questions.
Tests are the same problems from the PowerPoint with different numbers
you also get extra credit for attending breakouts and easy bonus questions on tests

I absolutely loved her class. She just reads off the powerpoint so attendance isn't really mandatory. Her tests are pretty much just the same prblms from the pptxs and breakout. I think physics couldn't get any easier. Just be able to do the prblms from the pptxs and you'll be good to go. I highly reccomend her if you are willing to review pptxs.
worst teacher, save your self and don't take her can't even teach
Great professor, very easy course and very lenient professor

Drops lowest lab at the end of the semester. There is a rule that if you are 15 minutes late you cannot participate in the lab for that week and will receive a 0. Overall class is pretty easy doesn't grade too harshly and should be an easy A if you complete your work. Very friendly, but doesn't add much to the class.
Excellent professor and a very easy grader, had a great time in lab

She wants her students to pass! Willing to work with you during her office hours. She also gives you everything that will be on the tests. All you have to do is study. As painful as physics may be to some, she doesn't make the class any harder than it has to be.
Tests are just like the recitations and lectures. Submit HW 2 days early and get 20% extra credit. Drops lowest exam, out of 4. Have to take final. Best professor ever!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: I took the 2211 lecture class, but there are no options here. The test is very similar to her lecture notes. You will get a good grade if you review notes before the test.

I wish she taught PHYS 1112 & 1112L.. that's how much I enjoyed her as a professor. She is nice, understanding, and not too tough of a grader. She allowed me to stay after many times to ask her physics-related questions. She made my early lab class enjoyable! The lab experiments themselves are fun and interactive!

I made an account just to come to defend this professor! She is very kind! 
Her exam questions are STRAIGHT from the lecture powerpoints or breakout sessions. She provides all the powerpoints so no outside work needed to find concepts. Go to class, go to the breakout sessions, study for a few days (not hours) for exams and you will get an A.

There are pros & cons to Kaplan 
The biggest con is that she expects to coming into her class knowing physics. Her teaching may click at times and other times not. She sometimes seems unsure of what she's saying? but she's nice, & gives extra credit in hw if u do it 2 days earlier. Study the lectures really well, I'm talking memorize the lectures

Her lectures are long, and you will need to learn how to decode her methods. A lot of times she includes ideas and formulas within lectures and does not explain where or how to make use of them. I reccomend using other sources for further explaination. On a positive note she does give extra credit for home work if you complete it early.

Professor Kaplan is super chill. She works out all the problems on her PowerPoint that are sometimes on the tests. Her breakout session is EVERYTHING!! 100% recommend going to those!! The homework is only like 4-6 questions a week and there isn't any on weeks there are tests. For a person who isn't naturally good at physics, I enjoyed her a lot!
She wasn't very helpful with answering questions and the lab manual being poorly written doesn't help either. Ask the lab assistant any questions you have and get the assignment done for a quick A

Professor Kaplan is a really sweet person. I took the lab and it was easy enough. Mostly just worked through the lab manual with lab group. No final, no tests, no midterm. Just the lab manual and she is a lenient grader.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy A. If you get 100 on all your labs, youll make a 100 in the class. It is not hard to do either if you complete your assignments on time. She only grades for completion and based off the requirements that its on time and a scanned pdf. As far as lab, she answers any questions without ridicule, and lets you leave early if you finish early.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: If you complete the homework early you receive extra credit. If you go to all her breakout sessions you will get extra credit. The subject itself is difficult but she can help you out. A couple of tests and your lowest one is dropped. She is a caring professor who provides enough extra credit to pass the class.
Very hard. Lectures and homework DO NOT prepare you for tests. Test questions are completely different. Take another professor instead.

Professor Kaplan is very sweet and cares a lot about the students. I had to miss a couple of labs and she waived the first one and provided me with the numbers for the second. You only have to purchase a lab manual for about $25 and the labs are very simple.

I failed my 1st exam (four and drops the lowest). I asked if we could go over the exam, which helped me a ton on what I needed to focus on for the next exam. 100% GO TO THE BREAKOUT SESSIONS there are very similar questions on the exams. The lectures were async, but the breakout was in person. Only three people consistently showed up.

This professor is very knowledgable and caring. She listens and understands her students. She is very lenient when it comes to grading. Tests are fair and they are straight from the recitation and lecture notes. If you study those, it's an easy A. She doesn't give any pop quizzes and gives extra credit if you finish the hw early.
Horrible professor. Does not care for students and barely replies to emails. Do not take her at all. Literally take any other professor but her. If I could rate 0/5 I would.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Kaplan should definitely have more great reviews. Took her intro to physics class over the summer and it was a great experience. Every thing is super straight forward and the tests were very similar to the practice problems. Take professor Kaplan, you wont regret it.

I am not sure why she doesn't have a bunch of great reviews. 4 tests and a final then you have web assign HW and worksheets that are basically the test. This class is super easy with her, she is patient and kind and usually lets out of class early too. I would definitely take her again, she actually listens to her students! She makes physics great.
